title: What! Documentary claims King Charles piloted a UFO in 1975!
content: The King of UFOs explores the British Royal Family's interest in UFOs and the paranormal and it has an interview of a person who claims to be an eyewitness to King Charles piloting a UFO in Canada in 1975. The maker of the film Christopher Lee said the claims might be quite far-fetched but it does seem possible after his research work.
summary: The King of UFOs explores the British Royal Family's interest in UFOs and the paranormal and it has an interview of a person who claims to be an eyewitness to King Charles piloting a UFO in Canada in 1975. The maker of the film Christopher Lee said the claims might be quite far-fetched but it does seem possible after his research work.

title: Donald Trump hints at this role for Elon Musk if he wins the presidency again...
content: Elon Musk could assume the role of 'Secretary of Cost-Cutting' in a potential Trump administration, focusing on efficiency. Trump lauded Musk's business acumen and space ambitions. Musk actively campaigns for Trump, emphasizing free speech concerns and advocating against a Kamala Harris presidency.
summary: Elon Musk could assume the role of 'Secretary of Cost-Cutting' in a potential Trump administration, focusing on efficiency. Trump lauded Musk's business acumen and space ambitions. Musk actively campaigns for Trump, emphasizing free speech concerns and advocating against a Kamala Harris presidency.

title: Fart of the deal: Mark and Mary fail to move MAGA devout from 'Diaper Don'
content: Top American general calls Trump a 'total fascist' and 'most dangerous person ever,' while Trump critics’ relentless attacks strengthen his support. Trump's derogatory remarks and scandals incite backlash, but polling shows no significant shift in voter support. Revenge themes dominate Trump's campaign rhetoric.
summary: Top American general calls Trump a 'total fascist' and 'most dangerous person ever,' while Trump critics’ relentless attacks strengthen his support. Trump's derogatory remarks and scandals incite backlash, but polling shows no significant shift in voter support. Revenge themes dominate Trump's campaign rhetoric.

title: 'Shocking and monumental in scale': UK woman sentenced to life after killing parents, living with bodies for four years
content: Virginia McCullough, 36, has been sentenced to life in prison with a minimum of 36 years for murdering her parents, Lois and John McCullough, in Great Baddow. Virginia poisoned her father and fatally beat and stabbed her mother, concealing their bodies for years for financial gain.
summary: Virginia McCullough, 36, has been sentenced to life in prison with a minimum of 36 years for murdering her parents, Lois and John McCullough, in Great Baddow. Virginia poisoned her father and fatally beat and stabbed her mother, concealing their bodies for years for financial gain.

title: Human head found in a box on Chicago street; investigation underway
content: A man's evening walk in Chicago took a gruesome turn when he discovered a human head in a box on West Taylor Street, mistaking it initially for a Halloween prop. Police and the Cook County Medical Examiner’s Office are investigating, with autopsy results pending. Authorities are also probing another case of skeletal remains found near the Kennedy Expressway in Bucktown.
summary: A man's evening walk in Chicago took a gruesome turn when he discovered a human head in a box on West Taylor Street, mistaking it initially for a Halloween prop. Police and the Cook County Medical Examiner’s Office are investigating, with autopsy results pending. Authorities are also probing another case of skeletal remains found near the Kennedy Expressway in Bucktown.

title: 'Disgusting': Gretchen Whitmer says sorry for Dorito-feeding video after Catholics say 'zero votes for Harris'
content: Michigan governor Gretchen Whitmer apologized for a video seen as mocking the Catholic sacrament, where she fed a Dorito chip to an influencer. The video was intended to promote the Chips Act and support Kamala Harris' campaign. Whitmer expressed regret for any offense caused and clarified it was never meant to disparage anyone's faith.
summary: Michigan governor Gretchen Whitmer apologized for a video seen as mocking the Catholic sacrament, where she fed a Dorito chip to an influencer. The video was intended to promote the Chips Act and support Kamala Harris' campaign. Whitmer expressed regret for any offense caused and clarified it was never meant to disparage anyone's faith.

title: Harris-Walz campaign aims for rural votes with bird hunt, Trump calls it a desperate bid for male support
content: Tim Walz, running mate of Kamala Harris, highlighted his rural background while participating in Minnesota’s pheasant hunting season. The outing was part of the 'Hunters and Anglers for Harris-Walz' initiative, aimed at appealing to rural voters and sportspeople. Despite not bagging any birds, the event was celebrated with a community luncheon.
summary: Tim Walz, running mate of Kamala Harris, highlighted his rural background while participating in Minnesota’s pheasant hunting season. The outing was part of the 'Hunters and Anglers for Harris-Walz' initiative, aimed at appealing to rural voters and sportspeople. Despite not bagging any birds, the event was celebrated with a community luncheon.

title: NBC poll says Trump and Harris are now tied at 48 per cent. Details here
content: An NBC poll shows Donald Trump and Kamala Harris tied at 48% support each. Trump gained four points since September, while Harris dropped by one. Key findings indicate significant gender and demographic gaps. Republican pollster McInturff said Harris' popularity waned as the vice president does not represent change from President Joe Biden and voters see Trump's presidency in a more positive light than Biden's. "She is asking for another term from the incumbent party," McInturff said.
summary: An NBC poll shows Donald Trump and Kamala Harris tied at 48% support each. Trump gained four points since September, while Harris dropped by one. Key findings indicate significant gender and demographic gaps. Republican pollster McInturff said Harris' popularity waned as the vice president does not represent change from President Joe Biden and voters see Trump's presidency in a more positive light than Biden's. "She is asking for another term from the incumbent party," McInturff said.

title: Barron Trump's former 'girlfriend' says the reason for their breakup was...
content: Though Barron's life is kept under the wraps, he's been linked to three women -- mostly through speculations. After Maddie, Barron apparently dated some Sarah Claire and now he has been dating model Klara Jones for the past six months, reportedly. Klara is two years older than Barron Trump. Some reports claimed Klara was seen with Barron Trump at many get togethers in the last six months.
summary: Though Barron's life is kept under the wraps, he's been linked to three women -- mostly through speculations. After Maddie, Barron apparently dated some Sarah Claire and now he has been dating model Klara Jones for the past six months, reportedly. Klara is two years older than Barron Trump. Some reports claimed Klara was seen with Barron Trump at many get togethers in the last six months.

title: 'Back home to mommy...': Trump's message to hecklers at Coachella rally
content: CNN reported how Donald Trump's rhetoric has gotten darker in the last leg of the campaigning. Politico White House reporter Daniel Lippman on the CNN show said it was not surprising and reminds one of his violent words in 2016 against protesters: 'Take them out on the stretcher'. "He feels the walls have closed in on him. That he faces potential jail time with criminal cases. If he loses this election, then there is a good chance that he will be in prison...he has gone darker," Lippman said.
summary: CNN reported how Donald Trump's rhetoric has gotten darker in the last leg of the campaigning. Politico White House reporter Daniel Lippman on the CNN show said it was not surprising and reminds one of his violent words in 2016 against protesters: 'Take them out on the stretcher'. "He feels the walls have closed in on him. That he faces potential jail time with criminal cases. If he loses this election, then there is a good chance that he will be in prison...he has gone darker," Lippman said.

title: Woman sues haunted house after breaking both ankles at the tourist attraction
content: Solainne Moncero-Tannis sues A Haunting in Hollis after breaking both ankles on a 20-foot slide. The haunted house has been shut down due to safety violations, including structural and electrical issues. This marks the fifth lawsuit against the attraction for injuries.
summary: Solainne Moncero-Tannis sues A Haunting in Hollis after breaking both ankles on a 20-foot slide. The haunted house has been shut down due to safety violations, including structural and electrical issues. This marks the fifth lawsuit against the attraction for injuries.

title: 'The big project': The secret strategy behind Hamas' surprise attack on Israel on Oct 7
content: Hamas leaders, including Yahya Sinwar, spent over two years planning an attack on Israel, revealed in documents obtained by The New York Times. They sought involvement from Iran and Hezbollah. The attack, initially planned for 2022, aimed to disrupt Israel's normalisation with Saudi Arabia and assert control over regional disputes.
summary: Hamas leaders, including Yahya Sinwar, spent over two years planning an attack on Israel, revealed in documents obtained by The New York Times. They sought involvement from Iran and Hezbollah. The attack, initially planned for 2022, aimed to disrupt Israel's normalisation with Saudi Arabia and assert control over regional disputes.

title: Why King Charles has not disclosed the list of gifts Royal Family received since 2020
content: ​Anti-monarchy campaign group Republic has hit out at the Royal Family and said if politicians are expected to display higher standards by mandatory disclosure of gifts, the same should be demanded from the royals as well. Graham Smith, chief executive of Republic, said: “If politicians are being lambasted for failing to declare gifts, the same should apply to the royals.
summary: ​Anti-monarchy campaign group Republic has hit out at the Royal Family and said if politicians are expected to display higher standards by mandatory disclosure of gifts, the same should be demanded from the royals as well. Graham Smith, chief executive of Republic, said: “If politicians are being lambasted for failing to declare gifts, the same should apply to the royals.

title: Video: Murder suspects disguise as energy workers before killing jewelry store owner
content: Authorities in Detroit have released doorbell footage showing two suspects posing as energy workers, before allegedly killing 72-year-old jewelry store owner Hussein Murray in his home. The suspects, wearing high-visibility vests and face masks, are being sought, with one already apprehended in Louisiana.
summary: Authorities in Detroit have released doorbell footage showing two suspects posing as energy workers, before allegedly killing 72-year-old jewelry store owner Hussein Murray in his home. The suspects, wearing high-visibility vests and face masks, are being sought, with one already apprehended in Louisiana.

title: Iran reduces sentence of jailed journalists after clearing them of collaborating with US
content: An Iranian court cleared Niloofar Hamedi and Elaheh Mohammadi of collaborating with the US, reducing their prison sentences to five years. They were originally jailed for reporting on the death of Mahsa Amini, which led to major protests in Iran in 2022 and 2023.
summary: An Iranian court cleared Niloofar Hamedi and Elaheh Mohammadi of collaborating with the US, reducing their prison sentences to five years. They were originally jailed for reporting on the death of Mahsa Amini, which led to major protests in Iran in 2022 and 2023.

title: Sudan rescuers say air strike killed 23 in Khartoum market
content: A Sudanese volunteer network reported that an airstrike by the military struck a marketplace near the paramilitary RSF's main camp in Khartoum, resulting in 23 fatalities and over 40 injuries. The attack on Saturday afternoon is part of ongoing civil conflict that has claimed thousands of lives.
summary: A Sudanese volunteer network reported that an airstrike by the military struck a marketplace near the paramilitary RSF's main camp in Khartoum, resulting in 23 fatalities and over 40 injuries. The attack on Saturday afternoon is part of ongoing civil conflict that has claimed thousands of lives.

title: Iran condemns 'illegal and unjustified' US sanctions on oil industry: ministry
content: Iran denounces US sanctions on its oil industry as 'illegal and unjustified' following Tehran's missile attack on Israel. The US targets firms and vessels involved in selling Iranian oil, while Iran insists on its right to respond and condemns the sanctions as threats to regional peace. The new wave of sanctions comes as the world awaits Israel's promised response to Tehran's missile attack, with oil prices hitting their highest levels since August.
summary: Iran denounces US sanctions on its oil industry as 'illegal and unjustified' following Tehran's missile attack on Israel. The US targets firms and vessels involved in selling Iranian oil, while Iran insists on its right to respond and condemns the sanctions as threats to regional peace. The new wave of sanctions comes as the world awaits Israel's promised response to Tehran's missile attack, with oil prices hitting their highest levels since August.

title: 'Still suffering, unable to work': Woman knocked out after cauliflower falls on her head
content: In the UK, Sammi Mai, 42, was hospitalized after a cauliflower fell on her head, causing her to lose consciousness. She continues to suffer from symptoms affecting her work life. She criticized the store for poor safety measures and is considering legal action. The store claims to have handled the incident promptly.
summary: In the UK, Sammi Mai, 42, was hospitalized after a cauliflower fell on her head, causing her to lose consciousness. She continues to suffer from symptoms affecting her work life. She criticized the store for poor safety measures and is considering legal action. The store claims to have handled the incident promptly.

title: New Sri Lankan government orders reinvestigation of several high-profile cases
content: Sri Lanka’s new government has directed the police to reinvestigate unresolved high-profile cases, including the 2019 Easter Sunday terror attacks, a 2005 Tamil journalist's murder, and other significant crimes. The Ministry of Public Security aims to identify investigative lapses and address alleged cover-ups by previous administrations.
summary: Sri Lanka’s new government has directed the police to reinvestigate unresolved high-profile cases, including the 2019 Easter Sunday terror attacks, a 2005 Tamil journalist's murder, and other significant crimes. The Ministry of Public Security aims to identify investigative lapses and address alleged cover-ups by previous administrations.

title: Israel-Hezbollah clash: Another UN peacekeeper injured amid escalating conflict
content: Hezbollah engaged Israeli forces in southern Lebanon as Israeli strikes hit UNIFIL bases, injuring peacekeepers. U.N. Secretary-General and Western countries condemned the attacks. Israeli assaults on Gaza killed 29 Palestinians amid ongoing military operations. Evacuations were ordered in northern Israel and southern Lebanon as conflict escalated with significant civilian displacement and casualties.
summary: Hezbollah engaged Israeli forces in southern Lebanon as Israeli strikes hit UNIFIL bases, injuring peacekeepers. U.N. Secretary-General and Western countries condemned the attacks. Israeli assaults on Gaza killed 29 Palestinians amid ongoing military operations. Evacuations were ordered in northern Israel and southern Lebanon as conflict escalated with significant civilian displacement and casualties.
